[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_delegator_balances] [Parent Table Reference] Can parent_table_handle be manipulated to point to incorrect pool data, enabling cross-pool share exploitation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_objects] [Object Deletion Flag] Can is_deleted be false for actually deleted objects, causing applications to reference non-existent on-chain data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_objects] [Owner Address Corruption] Can owner_address be changed without proper transfer events, enabling object theft or ownership disputes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_objects] [GUID Creation Overflow] Can last_guid_creation_num (Numeric) overflow, causing GUID collisions and object address conflicts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_objects] [Ungated Transfer Bypass] Can allow_ungated_transfer be changed post-creation to bypass transfer restrictions on soulbound objects? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_staking_pool_voter] [Voter Manipulation] Can voter_address be changed without proper authorization, allowing unauthorized governance voting with pool stake? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_staking_pool_voter] [Operator/Voter Inconsistency] Can operator_address and voter_address point to different entities in unexpected ways, causing governance or operational confusion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_table_items] [Key Hash Collision] The key_hash is limited to 64 characters - can hash collisions cause different table keys to map to the same entry? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_table_items] [Decoded Value Nullability] The decoded_value is Nullable - can this hide actual table values or indicate decoding failures that mask data corruption? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_table_items] [Deletion Flag Bypass] Can is_deleted be false when on-chain data is deleted, causing stale data queries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_table_items] [JSON Injection in decoded_key] The decoded_key is Jsonb - can malicious JSON injection corrupt table item queries or cause parsing errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_datas] [Supply/Maximum Violation] Can supply exceed maximum when maximum_mutable is false, indicating token minting exploits? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_datas] [Royalty Calculation Error] Can royalty_points_numerator exceed royalty_points_denominator, causing >100% royalty charges or division-by-zero errors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_datas] [Property Version Manipulation] Can largest_property_version (Numeric) be manipulated to hide token property mutation history? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_datas] [Mutability Flag Attack] Can mutability flags (maximum_mutable, uri_mutable, etc.) be changed after token creation, violating creator promises? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_datas_v2] [Fungibility Confusion] Can is_fungible_v2 (Nullable Bool) be manipulated to treat non-fungible tokens as fungible, enabling duplication attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_datas_v2] [Decimals Overflow] Can the decimals (Int8) field be set to extreme values causing amount calculation errors in fungible token transfers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_datas_v2] [Max Supply Null Exploit] Is maximum Nullable to allow unlimited minting, or can NULL be exploited to bypass supply caps? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_datas_v2] [Token Properties Injection] The token_properties field is Jsonb - can malicious JSON payloads corrupt token metadata or cause parsing DoS? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_ownerships] [Amount Consistency] For non-fungible tokens, can amount be >1, violating NFT uniqueness constraints? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_ownerships] [Property Version Mismatch] Can property_version be inconsistent with token_data property versions, causing ownership of wrong token variants? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_ownerships] [Token Properties Mutation] The token_properties (Jsonb) can change - are property mutations properly tracked to prevent unauthorized modifications? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_ownerships] [Table Type Corruption] Can table_type (Text) be manipulated to confuse different token storage schemes (TableWithLength vs regular Table)? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_ownerships_v2] [Soulbound Bypass] Can is_soulbound_v2 be changed from true to false, allowing transfer of supposed non-transferrable tokens? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_ownerships_v2] [Storage ID Collision] Can storage_id conflicts cause ownership records to overwrite each other, resulting in lost token ownership? (Critical)
